messages: e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:16): woohoo, ASCII case-insensitive CSS and case-sensitive author defined IDENTS (such as namespace prefixes, counter names, etc.)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:17): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, re #whatwg, SVG as 'background' could be one of the tests you have on the side
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:18): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, is media queries part of Acid3 yet?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:18): you could use "only all" on the main style sheet for instance :)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:18): i really don't want to add more "on the side" tests
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:19): i have a whole section on media queries
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:19): a whole test, rather
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:19): number?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:19): missed it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:19): not sure offhand
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:19): search for @media
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:20): ah, 46
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:20): missed that
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:22): testing outline-offset in some way?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:22): this is a dom/scripting test
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:22): i'd like to stick to scriptable stuff
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:22): you could test it through computed style and all
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:22): really at this point i just need one spec for which i can write 16 tests
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:22): cursor:url() without fallback might be another good one to test...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:23): how?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:23): although I guess that only fails in IE
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:23): what i really want to test is cursor url with a hotspot coordinate
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:23): but you can't really test visual things from the dom
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:23): you just encourage browsers to fake the support in the dom
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:24): which is the opposite of what i want to encourage
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:24): cursor:help; cursor:url(); cursorMustBeHelp()
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:24): eh, that's not a big deal
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (00:24): could add a cursorState property
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (00:25): for testing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:25): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: anyway, we already have a number of 'cursor' tests
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:25): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: what we need is new tests
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:25): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: for bucket 5
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:25): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: i just need some spec to test the heck out of
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:26): so I still think SVG would be nice, but you want to test that visually ideally
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:26): right
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:26): so svg is out
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (00:27): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, any advice on making an SVG Acid test?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:27): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: get the spec fixed first :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:27): (seriously -- that's one of the main reasons i don't want to go near svg in acid3, i don't want to constrain how the spec can be fixed)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:28): are you testing xml:base ?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:28): no
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:29): i could i guess
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:29): but that wouldn't be 16 tests :-)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:29): right
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:34): gives up
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:34): heh
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:34): now you see my problem :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:35): does it have a dom?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:35): (that people agree should be implemented?)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:35): MathML is like SVG, more about rendering (at this stage anyway)
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (00:36): it does have a DOM and a fair-sized API, but I don't think the API is implemented anywhere
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:36): Actually it does seem to have a bit of DOM
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:37): the parenthetical was really the more relevant question
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:38): seems better to not implement it and only do it when actual scenarios come up from authors
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:38): It wasn't really intended as a serious suggestion since MathML implementations are generally rather few and far between
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (00:38): I don't know how critical the MathML WG thinks the DOM aspect is, apart from the rendering
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:38): (re MathML DOM)
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (00:38): maybe you could ask the MathML WG about that

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:39): the problem with both MathML and E4X is that not all the browser vendors agree that it should be implemented at all, which makes it inappropriate for an acid test.
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (00:40): I think there are plenty of stable and well-defined features in SVG that could be in an Acid Test
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:40): Yeah, I tend to agree with that (not that it shouldn't be implemented but that it shouldn't be part of a DOM/script acid test)
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (00:40): and that would put more pressure on MS to implement it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:41): specs should get implemented on their own merits, not on the merits of trying to pass an acid test
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:41): in light of that statement I wonder about DOM traversal...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:42): yeah, dom traversal is difficult to justify, but easier to justify than svg at least :-)
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (00:42): this isn't about merit, 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, it's about interoperability
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:42): To be fair SVG already has several implementations
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (00:42): IE is the only modern browser without SVG support
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (00:43): What about Konqueror?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:44): How many people actually use Konqueror?
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (00:44): That doesn't make it not a modern browser :-)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:44): so apart from SVG and xml:base W3C doesn't have realistic candidates anymore; data: URIs, URIs, HTTP, and ECMAScript are already in... hmm
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (00:45): I think that Konq has SVG support
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (00:45): (I'd assume KDE4 Konqueror does SVG, but the latest released version doesn't appear to)
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (00:45): but don't quote me on that
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:46): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: Fair enough, although I guess I could describe Amaya as "modern" if modern means "under active development" :)
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (00:46): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Hmm, it doesn't seem to be supported when I test it - I just get a white box
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (00:47): huh... I'll have to research that more... I'd have thought it would align to WebKit more

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (00:49): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: I'll say that "modern" means "under active development and implements recently-specified features and intends to actually work for at least some users", so it includes Konqueror (since the developers have been adding CSS3 and <canvas> and SVG and things, even if they're not in the current releases) and excludes Amaya/Links/etc
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (00:50): hmmm... Amaya is still under development, and does support SVG, though not yet <canvas>
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (00:50): Oh, maybe I just need to install KSVG
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:50): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2: I'm not really disputing that Konq. is a modern browser.
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (00:51): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Amaya doesn't seem to be designed for users, though
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (00:52): waits for KSVG to compile
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:52): amaya doesn't even pass acid1, does it?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:54): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: is xhr going to LC soon?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:56): i've been requesting that for some time, but there seems to be some delay on the chair/W3C/new group thingie side
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:56): sigh
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:56): xhr2 should've been published as FPWD already as well ages ago
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:57): and I think we should move access-control to Last Call but I guess with the current storm of e-mails that's unlikely to happen

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:57): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I assume per the earlier discussion that DOM 3 XPath doesn't meet the criteria for testing despite being widely implemented and occasionally quite useful?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:57): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: there hasn't been anything new in those e-mails has there?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:57): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: yeah, i don't really want to test DOM3 XPath
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:57): as far as I can tell it's exactly the same discussion we had at the technical planery
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:58): and before the TPAC as the TPAC was already repeating said stuff (though I did get some nice insights on the caching :) )
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (00:58): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Aha, Konqueror does do SVG once I install the right bits
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (00:58): (though it gets the background colour wrong and doesn't resize properly)
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (00:58): well, I guess it's modern, then ;P
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (00:59): (and it still handles XHTML idiotically)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (00:59): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, the other new thing is that Jon (maybe others too?) can't grasp the use cases
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (01:00): (See e.g. http://canvex.lazyilluminati.com/83/play.xhtml which really shouldn't look so broken)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:00): you'd think that the Ajax ??? lead would know what to use client-side cross-site requests for
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (01:01): (assuming I haven't just got an unusually broken version of Konqueror installed)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:03): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: no comment
b844a0a98f81c321afe1d38ae37f3c28 (01:15): channel #html-wg
25812bf456959aa5f28dc570f341a3ba (01:15): is 'HTML WG meets 10 Jan; expects to publish HTML 5 spec 22 Jan http://www.w3.org/html/wg/tracker/agenda (logs: http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/ ) '
5d5b78699e57104f2fa03bbdf7b9197b (01:15): by DanC on Fri Dec 21 01:12:05
